problems.question: Which statement is true about the equation below? 3(2 − k) = −3k + 2
choices: A. The equation has no solution.
B. The equation has one solution.
C. The equation has two solutions.
D. The equation has infinitely many solutions.

problems.question: Which of the following equations has infinitely many solutions?
How many sets of two or more consecutive positive integers can be added to obtain a sum of 100?
The perimeter of a rectangle is 40 units. One side of the rectangle is 7 and the other is x+2. What is the value of x?

A family of five people has $200 to spend on fishing rods and fishing licenses. They spend a total of $20 on licenses. Assuming they buy 5 identical rods, what is the maximum amount they can spend on each rod?
problems.note: Do not include units ($) in your answer.
